column1: This is in a realm of true and in a realm false
column2: but you experience me as you turn and toss.

column1: Black we are and much admired. Men seek us if they are tired. We tire the horse
column2: comfort man. Guess this riddle if you can.

column1: He stands beside the road. In a purple cap at tattered green cloak. Those who touch him
column2: curse him.

column1: Where can you find roads without cars
column2: forests without trees and cities without houses?

column1: Give it food and it will live
column2: give it water and it will die.

column1: Who spends the day at the window
column2: goes to the table for meals. And hides at night?

column1: Take one out and scratch my head
column2: I am now black but once was red.

column1: Reaching stiffly for the sky
column2: I bare my fingers when its cold. In warmth I wear an emerald glove and in between I dress in gold.

column1: Ripped from my mother's womb. Beaten and burned
column2: I become a blood thirsty killer.

column1: What I am filled
column2: I can point the way. When I am empty. Nothing moves me. I have two skins. One without and one within.

column1: I sleep by day
column2: I fly by night. I have no feathers to aid my flight.

column1: When I'm metal or wood
column2: I help you get home. When I'm flesh and I'm blood. In the darkness I roam.

column1: I am always hungry
column2: I must always be fed. The finger I lick will soon turn red.

column1: Of these things - I have two. One for me - and one for you. And when you ask about the price
column2: I simply smile and nod twice.

column1: Although my cow is dead
column2: I still beat herÂ… What a racket she makes.

column1: I walked and walked and at last I got it. I didn't want it. So I stopped and looked for it. When I found it
column2: I threw it away.

column1: Soldiers line up spaced with pride. Two long rows lined side by side. One sole unit can decide
column2: if the rows will unit or divide.

column1: Break it and it is better
column2: immediately set and harder to break again.

column1: In the night a mountain
column2: in the morning a meadow.

column1: You must keep this thing. Its loss will affect your brothers. For once yours is lost
column2: it will soon be lost by others.

column1: Metal or bone I may be
column2: many teeth I have and always bared. Yet my bite harms no one. And ladies delight in my touch.

column1: A skin have I
column2: more eyes than one. I can be very nice when I am done.

column1: Lighter than what I am made of
column2: more of me is hidden than is seen. I am the bane of the mariner. A tooth within the sea.

column1: I am the outstretched fingers that seize and hold the wind. Wisdom flows from me in other hands. Upon me are sweet dreams dreamt
column2: my merest touch brings laughter.

column1: High born
column2: my touch is gentle. Purest white is my lace. Silence is my kingdom. Green is the color of my death.

column1: I drive men mad for love of me. Easily beaten
column2: never free.

column1: Long and slinky like a trout
column2: never sings till it's guts come out.

column1: A little house full of meat
column2: no door to go in and eat.

column1: To unravel me you need a simple key
column2: no key that was made by locksmith's hand. But a key that only I will understand.

column1: With pointed fangs it sits in wait. With piercing force it doles out fate
column2: over bloodless victims proclaiming its might. Eternally joining in a single bite.

column1: A harvest sown and reaped on the same day in an unplowed field. Which increases without growing
column2: remains whole though it is eaten within and without. Is useless and yet the staple of nations.

column1: What flies forever
column2: Rests never?

column1: Fatherless and motherless. Born without sin
column2: roared when it came into the world. And never spoke again.

column1: My first is in some but not in all. My second is into but not in tall. My third in little but no in big. My fourth in port but not in pig. My whole is made in nature's way. For clothing
column2: rugs used every day.

column1: I fly through the air on small feathered wings
column2: seeking out life and destroying all things.

column1: I cannot be felt
column2: seen or touched. Yet I can be found in everybody. My existence is always in debate. Yet I have my own style of music.

column1: A word I know
column2: six letters it contains. Subtract just one and twelve remains.

column1: Face with a tree
column2: skin like the sea. A great beast I am. Yet vermin frightens me.

column1: Screaming
column2: soaring seeking sky. Flowers of fire flying high. Eastern art from ancient time. Name me now and solve this rhyme.

column1: Some live in me
column2: some live on. And some shave me to stride upon. I rarely leave my native land. Until my death I always stand. High and low I may be found. Both above and below ground.

column1: I am the red tongue of the earth
column2: that buries cities.

column1: The sharp slim blade
column2: that cuts the wind.

column1: Three little letters. A paradox to some. The worse that it is
column2: the better it becomes.

column1: The more of it there is
column2: the less you see.

column1: You use it between your head and your toes
column2: the more it works the thinner it grows.

column1: Sometimes I am loud. And viewed with distaste. Poke out my 'eye'
column2: then I'm on the front of your face.

column1: I appear in the morning. But am always there. You can never see me. Though I am everywhere. By night I am gone
column2: though I sometimes never was. Nothing can defeat me. But I am easily gone.

column1: I'm not really more than holes tied to more holes. I'm strong as good steel
column2: though not as stiff as a pole.

column1: I can run but not walk. Wherever I go
column2: thought follows close behind.

column1: A seed am I
column2: three letters make my name. Take away two and I still sound the same.

column1: Different lights do make me strange
column2: thus into different sizes I will change.

column1: Though desert men once called me God
column2: today men call me mad. For I wag my tail when I am angry. And growl when I am glad.

column1: I have four wings but cannot fly. I never laugh and never cry. On the same spot always found
column2: toiling away with little sound.

column1: What has a neck and no head
column2: two arms but no hands?

column1: I cannot be other than what I am
column2: until the man who made me dies. Power and glory will fall to me finally. Only when he last closes his eyes.

column1: You can spin
column2: wheel and twist. But this thing can turn without moving.

column1: Today he is there to trip you up. And he will torture you tomorrow. Yet he is also there to ease the pain
column2: when you are lost in grief and sorrow.

column1: Hold the tail
column2: while I fish for you.

column1: A horrid monster hides from the day
column2: with many legs and many eyes. With silver chains it catches prey. And eats it all before it dies. Yet in every cottage does it stay. And every castle beneath the sky.

column1: There are two meanings to me. With one I may need to be broken
column2: with the other I hold on. My favorite characteristic is my charming dimple.

column1: What is pronounced like one letter
column2: written with three letters. And belongs to all animals?

column1: What surrounds the world
column2: yet dwells within a thimble?

column1: Until I am measured. I am not known
column2: yet how you miss me when I have flown.

column1: I have holes on the top and bottom. I have holes on my left and on my right. And I have holes in the middle
column2: Yet I still hold water.

column1: I'm full of holes
column2: yet I'm full of water.

column1: I am two-faced but bear only one. I have no legs but travel widely. Men spill much blood over me. Kings leave their imprint on me. I have greatest power when given away
column2: yet lust for me keeps me locked away.

column1: What does no man want
column2: yet no man want to lose?

column1: I'm light as a feather
column2: yet the strongest man can't hold me for more than 5 minutes. What am I?

column1: No matter how little or how much you use me
column2: you change me every month.

column1: It's true I bring serenity. And hang around the stars. But yet I live in misery
column2: you'll find me behind bars. With thieves and villains I consort. In prison I'll be found. But I would never go to court. Unless there's more than one.

column1: What is it that given one
column2: you'll have either two or none?

column1: My life is often a volume of grief
column2: your help is needed to turn a new leaf. Stiff is my spine and my body is pale. But I'm always ready to tell a tale.

column1: A beggar's brother went out to sea and drowned. But the man who drowned had no brother. Who was the beggar to the man who drowned?
A house of wood in a hidden place. Built without nails or glue. High above the earthen ground. It holds pale gems of blue.
A little pool with two layers of wall around it. One white and soft and the other dark and hard. Amidst a light brown grassy lawn with an outline of a green grass.
A nut cracker up in a tree.
As round as an apple. As deep as a cup. All the king's horses can't pull it up.
At night I come without being fetched. By day I am lost without being stolen.
Come up and let us go. Go down and here we stay.
Dies half its life. Lives the rest. Dances without music. Breathes without breath.
Glittering points that downward thrust. Sparkling spears that never rust.
Hands she has but does not hold. Teeth she has but does not bite. Feet she has but they are cold. Eyes she has but without sight.
Hard iron on horse. Cow's hide on man.
He has married many women but has never married.
He has one and a person has two. A citizen has three. And a human being has four. A personality has five. And an inhabitant of earth has six.
How far will a blind dog walk into a forest?
I am a box that holds black and white keys without locks. Yet they can unlock your soul.
I am so simple that I can only point. Yet I guide men all over the world.
I am the yellow hem of the sea's blue skirt.
I bind it and it walks. I loose it and it stops.
I build up castles. I tear down mountains. I make some men blind. I help others to see.
I crawl on the earth. And rise on a pillar.

I dig out tiny caves and store gold and silver in them. I also build bridges of silver and make crowns of gold. They are the smallest you could imagine. Sooner or later everybody needs my help. Yet many people are afraid to let me help them.
I don't think or eat or slumber. Or move around or fear thunder. Just like you I look the same but I can't harm you or be your bane.
I have a neck but no head. I have a body but no arm. I have a bottom but no leg.
I have a title and many pages. I am a genteel of genteel descent. I am a killer veteran of war. I am a slave to my lord pledged to his service.
I have four legs but no tail. Usually I am heard only at night.
I have one eye. See near and far. I hold the moments you treasure and the things that make you weep.
I have split the one into five. I am the circle that few will spy. I am the path that breaks and gives. I am the bow no man may bend.
I hide but my head is outside.
I occur once in a minute...
I occur twice in eternity. And I'm always within sight.
I run through hills. I veer around mountains. I leap over rivers. And crawl through the forests. Step out your door to find me.
I turn around once. What is out will not get in. I turn around again. What is in will not get out.
I usually wear a yellow coat. I usually have a dark head. I make marks wherever I go.
If you drop me I'm sure to crack. But give me a smile and I'll always smile back.
I'm a god. I'm a planet. I measure heat.
I'm sometimes white and always wrong. I can break a heart and hurt the strong. I can build love or tear it down. I can make a smile or bring a frown.
Inside a great blue castle lives a shy young maid. She blushes in the morning and comes not out at night.
It occurs once in every minute. Twice in every moment and yet never in one hundred thousand years.
It's in your hand though you can not feel it. Only you and time can reveal it.
Late afternoons I often bathe. I'll soak in water piping hot. My essence goes through. My see through clothes. Used up am I - I've gone to pot.
Long slim and slender. Dark as homemade thunder. Keen eyes and peaked nose. Scares the Devil wherever it goes.
Look into my face and I'm everybody. Scratch my back and I'm nobody.
Mountains will crumble and temples will fall. And no man can survive its endless call.
My children are near and far. No matter that I know where they are. The gift I give them make their day. But if I were gone they would wander away.

My first is in fish but no in snail. My second is in rabbit but no in tail. My third is in up but not in down. My fourth is in tiara but not in crown. My fifth is in tree you plainly see. My whole a food for you and me.
My first is in ocean but never in sea. My second's in wasp but never in bee. My third is in glider and also in flight. My whole is a creature that comes out at night.

My first is in window but not in pane. My second's in road but not in lane. My third is in oval but not in round. My fourth is in hearing but not in sound. My whole is known as a sign of peace. And from noah's ark won quick release.
My first is twice in apple but not once in tart. My second is in liver but not in heart. My third is in giant and also in ghost. Whole I'm best when I am toast.
My thunder comes before the lightning. My lightning comes before the clouds. My rain dries all the land it touches.
No sooner spoken than broken.
Often held but never touched. Always wet but never rusts. Often bits but seldom bit. To use it well you must have wit.
Only two backbones and thousands of ribs.
People are hired to get rid of me. I'm often hiding under your bed. In time I'll always return you see. Bite me and you're surely dead.
Power enough to smash ships and crush roofs. Yet it still must fear the sun.
Remove the outside. Cook the inside. Eat the outside. Throw away the inside.
Snake coiled round and round. Snake deep below the ground. Snake that's never had a head. Snake that binds but not with dread.
The eight of us move forth and back. To protect our king from the foes attack.
The man who made it didn't need it. The man who bought it didn't use it. The man who used it didn't want it.
The moon is my father. The sea is my mother. I have a million brothers. I die when I reach land.
The strangest creature you'll ever find has two eyes in front and a hundred behind.
There is an ancient invention. Still used in some parts of the world today. That allows people to see through walls.
There is one in every corner and two in every room.
Three lives have I. Gentle enough to soothe the skin. Light enough to caress the sky. Hard enough to crack rocks.
Twigs and spheres and poles and plates. Join and bind to reason make.
Two in a whole and four in a pair. And six in a trio you see. And eight's a quartet but what you must get. Is the name that fits just one of me?
Two little holes in the side of a hill. Just as you come to the cherry-red mill.
Up on high I wave away but not a word can I say.
We are five little objects of an everyday sort. You will find us all in a tennis court.
What always goes to bed with his shoes on?
What an fill a room but takes up no space?
What animal keeps the best time?
What asks but never answers?
What building has the most stories?
What can be heard and caught but never seen?
What can touch someone once and last them a life time?
What can you catch but not throw?
What do you fill with empty hands?
What do you throw out to use and take in when you're done?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two more letters?
What flies without wings? What passes all things? What mends all sorrow? What brings the morrow?
What gets bigger the more you take away from it?
What gets wetter the more it dries.
What goes around the world and stays in a corner?
What goes further the slower it goes?
What goes in the water black and comes out red?
What goes through a door but never goes in. And never comes out?
What goes through the door without pinching itself? What sits on the stove without burning itself? What sits on the table and is not ashamed?
What goes up but never comes down?
What goes up when the rain comes down?
What has a single eye but cannot see?
What has six faces and twenty-one eyes?
What has to be broken before it can be used?
What is brown and sticky?
What is it that makes tears without sorrow. And takes its journey to heaven?
What is it that you must give before you can keep it.
What is that over the head and under the hat?
What is the difference between a grandmother and a granary?
column8: one is one's born-kin, the other is one's corn-bin

column1: What kind of nut is empty at the center and has no shell.
What kind of pet always stays on the floor?
What kind of room has no windows or doors?
What lies in a tunnel of darkness. That can only attack when pulled back?
What loses its head in the morning and gets it back at night?
What makes a loud noise when changing its jacket. Becomes larger but weighs less?
What measures out time. Until in time all is smashed to it?
What must be in the oven yet can not be baked? Grows in the heat yet shuns the light of day? What sinks in water but rises with air? Looks like skin but is fine as hair?
What runs around all day. Then lies under the bed. With its tongue hanging out?
What two things can you never eat for breakfast?
What wears a coat in the winter and pants in the summer?
What's in the middle of nowhere?
When set loose I fly away. Never so cursed as when I go astray.
When the day after tomorrow is yesterday. Today will be as far from Wednesday. As today was from Wednesday. When the day before yesterday was tomorrow. What is the day after this day?
Who is he that runs without a leg. And his house on his back?
Who works when he plays and plays when he works?
With sharp edged wit and pointed poise. It can settle disputes without making a noise.
You can see nothing else when you look in my face. I will look you in the eye and I will never lie.
You use a knife to slice my head. And weep beside me when I am dead.
